these prints turned out really well.... so aside.... if you don't mind me asking.... how much did those frames cost you o.o because i'm slightly scared to make anything over 24"x36" if i have to frame it due to framing costs.
So this is a hand shot stop motion (not done digitally) which is shot on a 3x5 foot digital print, everything else is relief printed, cut up, and moved slowly over and over and over.

due to some unbeknownst circumstances, my school has a mountian of photolitho plates that we can use for free... which is why i'm making a bunch of photo lithos :P and my website is: Toddherzberg.com haven't updated it in a minute though.

well i mean if i was a restaurant owner, and i had a party of 20 coming... I might set up an area that could accommodate 20 people, maybe something like a "banquet" area. and since that would take time to set up... and i'd probably have to bring in an extra staff or 2 just to set up/ take care of that group, i might make them put down a deposit, so i didn't get screwed over if they didn't show i mean 20 seats on a friday is kinda a big section to take on a misc called in rsvp. then maybe as a resturant owner, which some jackass comes into my restaurant, and probably throws a hissy fit about how he must have misunderstood the banquet reservation policy, i'd tell him or her to fuck off..... but thats just me.
this is my concern for this print. not having enough room for the scraper bar to start/ stop on the stone can be harmful to both the stone, and the scraper bar.

Exactly. You need a the materials surface to come into contact with the blocks face, and the canvas' weave makes that nearly impossible to get a good impression.
Still really want to print on canvas? Well you could try loosening up the ink, which will allow it to get into the weave better, but you're going to loose detail, but if you're cool with that give it a go.
i mean if your just looking for a black, Ukiyo-e ink uses Sumi ink. you can probably get it at any local art store. might be in the drawing section though

I'd say the best advise I can give yah is just keep at it, you don't get good at anything in printmaking on your first go, it takes a lot of time before you can get good at even the simplest things.

Thanks and yah the screens were just me trying it out and carving that much type would be awful. don't think I'll become a full time screen printer any time soon. But it's really nice being a able to knock out color so much faster that it is with linoleum. Not to mention Jay Ryan is one of my print crushes so I figured I'd try to do these in something slightly akin to his style.

It's hand done stop motion. The background is a physical 3x5foot digital print, and the characters are all carved linoleum relief prints, then I cut those up layer the accordingly and start taking photos.
I tried to teach myself digital stopmotion, but ended up hating it after 2 weeks of frustration, which is when I switched to hand-made stop motion
Edit: this is my shooting set up https://instagram.com/p/-pW-NSjoxd/

I for one welcome the new mod, it's s small community, so it shouldn't be too much work for yah. It'd be cool if we could somehow get this place a bit more lively. I did a Reddit /r/printmaking print exchange in last year, but something like that might be kinda fun to get people to interact, even if it's only a digital thing. Maybe weekly challenges or something, idk. But anyway God bless you sir, I'll try to post more in here

I use either Graphic Chemical Etching Vine Black or Gamblin Relief Portland Black. If you want to drop to much money you can get Graphic Chemical's shop mix black.... but i'd never buy it because its too damn expensive (60 bucks a can). Also you could check out Gamblin's signature inks such as Drive by Black (for Tshirts) or Tom Huck's Outlaw Black (his relief black)

I go to broke spoke, it's a bike coop so you basically do your own repairs (they'll help you if you don't know what your doing) or you can have them do it for you I believe.
Last summer my bottom bracket blew out on me, pedal power wanted somethin like 100+ bucks for a rebuild (that could be off but it was pretty expensive... Well expensive for my budget anyway). Being broke I went to broke spoke to check their prices, walked in, ended up rebuilding it myself (with help from a friendly volunteer) used some spare parts and it cost me something like 7.50. If your willing to learn and have the time, broke spoke is where it's at.

So if you look at this video, is me pulling a print. The piece of paper on the bed is my registration sheet. Its the same size as the actual print (though you could change that). then the plate basically has an outline that i just trace around the plate, and place it in the same spot every time.
https://instagram.com/p/5LF-P5jo9t/?taken-by=toddherzberg

look around on there for less current, but more well rounded info. i'm pretty sure they had a bunch of print shops around, no idea how public/ private they were, but if you flick thru the "venue" tab i'm sure you could find some places, and email some people of ones that look promising

People asking about housing on this sub all the time. hard to give any pointers with out price range. Its like saying "i want to buy a car, what should i get?" well without a price range or your qualifications I could suggest anything from Chevy Aveo or a Lamborghini Aventador

i mean my registration is literally just a piece of paper (the same size as my printing paper) with an outline of the blocks drawn onto it, its far from fancy. granted, theres some movement in the prints, but all in all its not to bad for basically free hand registration.

WRITING.TEXT: Don't know if their PR can get any worse than it already is.

from the FB page...
To clarify, this is NOT A RALLY. He won't be here. He will be broadcasting to the 1500 separate viewing parties that night, but he will not be in Lexington.
What we are trying, as part of creating a political revolution, is creating a grass-roots movement of millions and millions of people, Sanders said. On July 29 of this month, we will be holding what we believe will be the largest digital organizing event in the history of this country."
Come be a part of the largest digital organizing event in history. Join us and our grassroots revolution!
Al's Bar is willing to host us crazy Bernie folk! Please consider buying a burger or a beer while you're there. He will be broadcasting a live web address to us at 7pm. There will be cards to register to vote, as well as info about Bernie the issues that you can take with you.
**THIS IS A RAIN OR SHINE EVENT. THERE IS LIMITED INDOOR SPACE BUT AL'S IS LETTING US USE THEIR OUTDOOR SPACE AS WELL, AND THEY CAN HOLD US THAT WAY!**
The Sanders campaign announced a nationwide effort to hold organizing meetings and house parties on July 29th! Sanders is rocketing up the polls, even raised $15 million since announcing April 30, not one cent of it from corporate donations.
https://secure.berniesanders.com/page/event/detail/july29organizingmeetingat7pmetpt/4jvzc
Come because it'll be fun! Bernie Sanders has a lot of potential for being a candidate that can take this country by storm, but not without our help!
